values.description:
There are a couple of important points here, which probably deserve to look at separate commits:

 * [Rethink and change](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/e9352f0a2330ee0680b2e2f99eb764f1c40c8972) previous definition of gz_build_ DISPLAY, DRI and Qt. New approach is: DRI and DISPLAY do not go for linking to Qt. Qt is a separate macro which depends on VALID_DRI. Seems to work fine for current test suite.
 * Regression tests needed to link against extra sources (server.cc, master.cc, ...) due to use of TextFixture file. To avoid code duplication, [a hack was done](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/2c2e2318c0bad1231edbb5766ab192c5464d181b) to provide extra sources in a variable, since all arguments passed to the macro are consider test source files.

Further work is needed to move some tests from regression to proper unit test places but this out of the scope of this pull request.
values.title: Move regression tests to use proper gz build functions

summary.raw:
There are a couple of important points here, which probably deserve to look at separate commits:

 * [Rethink and change](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/e9352f0a2330ee0680b2e2f99eb764f1c40c8972) previous definition of gz_build_ DISPLAY, DRI and Qt. New approach is: DRI and DISPLAY do not go for linking to Qt. Qt is a separate macro which depends on VALID_DRI. Seems to work fine for current test suite.
 * Regression tests needed to link against extra sources (server.cc, master.cc, ...) due to use of TextFixture file. To avoid code duplication, [a hack was done](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/2c2e2318c0bad1231edbb5766ab192c5464d181b) to provide extra sources in a variable, since all arguments passed to the macro are consider test source files.

Further work is needed to move some tests from regression to proper unit test places but this out of the scope of this pull request.
summary.html:
There are a couple of important points here, which probably deserve to look at separate commits:

  • Rethink and change previous definition of gz_build_ DISPLAY, DRI and Qt. New approach is: DRI and DISPLAY do not go for linking to Qt. Qt is a separate macro which depends on VALID_DRI. Seems to work fine for current test suite.
  • Regression tests needed to link against extra sources (server.cc, master.cc, ...) due to use of TextFixture file. To avoid code duplication, a hack was done to provide extra sources in a variable, since all arguments passed to the macro are consider test source files.

Further work is needed to move some tests from regression to proper unit test places but this out of the scope of this pull request.

values.description:
Failure case:
  1) Run gzserver on a remote machine with a model that has meshes (like the pr2)

  2) Remove the `~/.gazebo/models` directory on your local machine.

  3) Run gzclient on your local machine.

  4) The pr2 models will not be downloaded by gzclient.

This pull-request fixes the above problem.

If you're located at OSRF, I have a gzserver instance running right now @ 192.168.105 for your testing pleasure. Just run:

    GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://192.168.1.105:11345 gzclient

and you should get a pioneer2dx.
values.title: Allow gzclient to download model files if they are missing.

summary.html:
Failure case: 1) Run gzserver on a remote machine with a model that has meshes (like the pr2)

2) Remove the ~/.gazebo/models directory on your local machine.

3) Run gzclient on your local machine.

4) The pr2 models will not be downloaded by gzclient.

This pull-request fixes the above problem.

If you're located at OSRF, I have a gzserver instance running right now @ 192.168.105 for your testing pleasure. Just run:

and you should get a pioneer2dx.

values.description:
Bullet has a default margin size of 0.04. This seems to affect convex trimesh shapes and create gaps between objects. Manually setting the margin does the trick. 

Also added a trimesh drop test but commented it out because it fails in ode mode. Ticketed issue #513
values.title: Fix bullet mesh offset

summary.raw:
Bullet has a default margin size of 0.04. This seems to affect convex trimesh shapes and create gaps between objects. Manually setting the margin does the trick. 

Also added a trimesh drop test but commented it out because it fails in ode mode. Ticketed issue #513
summary.html:
Bullet has a default margin size of 0.04. This seems to affect convex trimesh shapes and create gaps between objects. Manually setting the margin does the trick.

Also added a trimesh drop test but commented it out because it fails in ode mode. Ticketed issue #513

summary.html:
This is round 1 of diagnostic timing.

Timing is enabled using a compile flag:

cmake -DENABLE_DIAGNOSTICS=true ../

Timing output is then stored in a timestamped directory in ~/.gazebo/diagnostics

To add a new timer use:

DIAG_TIMER_START(MyNewTimerName);

<some code>

DIAG_TIMER_LAP(MyNewTimerName, "some annotation");

<some code>

DIAG_TIMER_STOP(MyNewTimerName);

values.description: With the Atlas robot in drcsim, Reset World is not usable since it causes the controllers to fail. This patch changes Reset Model Poses to reset links as well, so that the linear and angular velocity of each link is reset. This makes it easier to pick up the Atlas robot when it falls down.
values.title: Cause Reset Model Poses action to reset linear and angular velocity as well

summary.raw: With the Atlas robot in drcsim, Reset World is not usable since it causes the controllers to fail. This patch changes Reset Model Poses to reset links as well, so that the linear and angular velocity of each link is reset. This makes it easier to pick up the Atlas robot when it falls down.
summary.html: With the Atlas robot in drcsim, Reset World is not usable since it causes the controllers to fail. This patch changes Reset Model Poses to reset links as well, so that the linear and angular velocity of each link is reset. This makes it easier to pick up the Atlas robot when it falls down.

Deferred setting bullet link params until the rigid body has been created and added to the world otherwise they do not get set.

values.description:
This is round 1 of diagnostic timing.
Timing is enabled using a compile flag:

    cmake -DENABLE_DIAGNOSTICS=true ../

Timing output is then stored in a timestamped directory in `~/.gazebo/diagnostics`

To add a new timer use:

    DIAG_TIMER_START(MyNewTimerName);

    <some code>

    DIAG_TIMER_LAP(MyNewTimerName, "some annotation");

    <some code>

    DIAG_TIMER_STOP(MyNewTimerName);

There is also a Plotting Widget. Keep in mind that this is very rudimentary at the moment.


John:: added a new timer in World::Update call.

values.description:
If joint velocity limits are not given in an sdf, they are currently set to zero, so no torque can be applied. This [broke the JointDamping test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-precise-amd64/227/testReport/junit/%28root%29/PhysicsTest/JointDampingTest/).

This is similar to the fix in pull request #323.
values.title: Fix joint velocity limits and JointDamping test

summary.raw:
If joint velocity limits are not given in an sdf, they are currently set to zero, so no torque can be applied. This [broke the JointDamping test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-precise-amd64/227/testReport/junit/%28root%29/PhysicsTest/JointDampingTest/).

This is similar to the fix in pull request #323.
summary.html:
If joint velocity limits are not given in an sdf, they are currently set to zero, so no torque can be applied. This broke the JointDamping test.

This is similar to the fix in pull request #323.

values.description:
This includes a test for RevoluteJoints that verifies that the axis, angle and velocity measurement, and torque application directions are all consistent. It passes in both ODE and bullet. The test world includes a circle of double pendulums in `sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world`.

It includes a fair bit of refactoring to the prismatic BulletSliderJoint and BulletScrewJoint. These joints don't have tests, so they represent a work in progress.

This pull request also enables Atlas to be loaded in bullet, though the solver parameters still need to be adjusted.
values.title: BulletHingeJoint fixes: allows Atlas to load, fix #493, #497

summary.raw:
This includes a test for RevoluteJoints that verifies that the axis, angle and velocity measurement, and torque application directions are all consistent. It passes in both ODE and bullet. The test world includes a circle of double pendulums in `sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world`.

It includes a fair bit of refactoring to the prismatic BulletSliderJoint and BulletScrewJoint. These joints don't have tests, so they represent a work in progress.

This pull request also enables Atlas to be loaded in bullet, though the solver parameters still need to be adjusted.
summary.html:
This includes a test for RevoluteJoints that verifies that the axis, angle and velocity measurement, and torque application directions are all consistent. It passes in both ODE and bullet. The test world includes a circle of double pendulums in sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world.

It includes a fair bit of refactoring to the prismatic BulletSliderJoint and BulletScrewJoint. These joints don't have tests, so they represent a work in progress.

This pull request also enables Atlas to be loaded in bullet, though the solver parameters still need to be adjusted.

values.description:
Added a function to SensorManger that explicitly resets the lastUpdateTime for each sensor. World then calls this function at the appropriate time. This replaces a message based system that lacked proper synchronization.

Fix for issue #236
values.title: Fixed Sensor time reset

values.description:
There was an infinite loop in ServerFixture::SpawnSDF that was one of our tests was getting stuck in (issue #530). I changed SpawnSDF to be similar to the other Spawn functions so that it blocks (with a timeout) until the model has been successfully loaded by the world. I added a test.

Currently the CollisionFiltering physics test is the only one that uses SpawnSDF, and this pull request should make it pass. I tested it with the gazebo-any build earlier:
values.title: Fix for #530: infinite loop in SpawnSDF causes test to fail

summary.raw:
There was an infinite loop in ServerFixture::SpawnSDF that was one of our tests was getting stuck in (issue #530). I changed SpawnSDF to be similar to the other Spawn functions so that it blocks (with a timeout) until the model has been successfully loaded by the world. I added a test.

Currently the CollisionFiltering physics test is the only one that uses SpawnSDF, and this pull request should make it pass. I tested it with the gazebo-any build earlier:
summary.html:
There was an infinite loop in ServerFixture::SpawnSDF that was one of our tests was getting stuck in (issue #530). I changed SpawnSDF to be similar to the other Spawn functions so that it blocks (with a timeout) until the model has been successfully loaded by the world. I added a test.

Currently the CollisionFiltering physics test is the only one that uses SpawnSDF, and this pull request should make it pass. I tested it with the gazebo-any build earlier:

values.description:
While investigating issue #268, I noticed that `gztopic hz` incurs a substantial performance hit by subscribing to debug topics that require message serialization by the publisher. The command `gztopic bw` does not incur this performance hit, since it subscribes to the regular topic, so I changed `gztopic hz` to do the same.

To test this, open `gazebo sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world` and `gztopic hz /gazebo/default/physics/contacts > /dev/null` in a separate terminal. Without this patch, you will see real-time factor cut about in half. `gztopic echo` will still reduce the real-time factor until #268 is resolved.
values.title: Reduce gazebo performance lag when running gztopic hz

summary.raw:
While investigating issue #268, I noticed that `gztopic hz` incurs a substantial performance hit by subscribing to debug topics that require message serialization by the publisher. The command `gztopic bw` does not incur this performance hit, since it subscribes to the regular topic, so I changed `gztopic hz` to do the same.

To test this, open `gazebo sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world` and `gztopic hz /gazebo/default/physics/contacts > /dev/null` in a separate terminal. Without this patch, you will see real-time factor cut about in half. `gztopic echo` will still reduce the real-time factor until #268 is resolved.
summary.html:
While investigating issue #268, I noticed that gztopic hz incurs a substantial performance hit by subscribing to debug topics that require message serialization by the publisher. The command gztopic bw does not incur this performance hit, since it subscribes to the regular topic, so I changed gztopic hz to do the same.

To test this, open gazebo sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world and gztopic hz /gazebo/default/physics/contacts > /dev/null in a separate terminal. Without this patch, you will see real-time factor cut about in half. gztopic echo will still reduce the real-time factor until #268 is resolved.

values.description:
I realized that SetDamping is the same in all derived ODE*Joint classes, so I moved it into ODEJoint.cc.

Added a flag so ConnectJointUpdate is not called repeatedly when SetDamping is called.

Added a flag change when SetDamping is called so the new coefficient takes effect.

---

allows infinite viscous damping coefficient at the cost of 1 new constraint row.

by product:  implemented GetAttribute (analogous to SetAttribute) and fixed setting lo\_stop and hi\_stop (previously ignored joint index).
values.title: use cfm for viscous damping.

summary.raw:
I realized that SetDamping is the same in all derived ODE*Joint classes, so I moved it into ODEJoint.cc.

Added a flag so ConnectJointUpdate is not called repeatedly when SetDamping is called.

Added a flag change when SetDamping is called so the new coefficient takes effect.

---

allows infinite viscous damping coefficient at the cost of 1 new constraint row.

by product:  implemented GetAttribute (analogous to SetAttribute) and fixed setting lo\_stop and hi\_stop (previously ignored joint index).
summary.html:
I realized that SetDamping is the same in all derived ODE*Joint classes, so I moved it into ODEJoint.cc.

Added a flag so ConnectJointUpdate is not called repeatedly when SetDamping is called.

Added a flag change when SetDamping is called so the new coefficient takes effect.

allows infinite viscous damping coefficient at the cost of 1 new constraint row.

by product: implemented GetAttribute (analogous to SetAttribute) and fixed setting lo_stop and hi_stop (previously ignored joint index).

values.description:
issue #555

Found this issue when testing contact sensor in worlds/contact.world. The sensor thread was sleeping forever and not publishing to the topics. This is due to sleep time being calculated as `1.0/maxUpdateRate` where `maxUpdateRate` was initialized to `GZ_DBL_MIN`.
values.title: Fix sensor thread sleep time

summary.raw:
issue #555

Found this issue when testing contact sensor in worlds/contact.world. The sensor thread was sleeping forever and not publishing to the topics. This is due to sleep time being calculated as `1.0/maxUpdateRate` where `maxUpdateRate` was initialized to `GZ_DBL_MIN`.
summary.html:
issue #555

Found this issue when testing contact sensor in worlds/contact.world. The sensor thread was sleeping forever and not publishing to the topics. This is due to sleep time being calculated as 1.0/maxUpdateRate where maxUpdateRate was initialized to GZ_DBL_MIN.

values.description:
In pull request #330, the function Joint::GetForce(int) was deprecated and Joint::GetForce(unsigned int) was created to replace it. However, both functions are marked as deprecated. This unmarks Joint::GetForce(unsigned int) as deprecated.

This also fixes one compiler warning, though there are still several others remaining.
values.title: Fix warning: unmark Joint::GetForce(unsigned int) as deprecated

summary.raw:
In pull request #330, the function Joint::GetForce(int) was deprecated and Joint::GetForce(unsigned int) was created to replace it. However, both functions are marked as deprecated. This unmarks Joint::GetForce(unsigned int) as deprecated.

This also fixes one compiler warning, though there are still several others remaining.
summary.html:
In pull request #330, the function Joint::GetForce(int) was deprecated and Joint::GetForce(unsigned int) was created to replace it. However, both functions are marked as deprecated. This unmarks Joint::GetForce(unsigned int) as deprecated.

This also fixes one compiler warning, though there are still several others remaining.

values.description:
Dragging and drop of model from the online model database was broken. The URI parsing was broken. 

Included is a style fix in ODEJoint_Test.cc, and error checking in VehiclePlugin.cc

Fix for issue #5 in `gazebo_models` repo
values.title: Fix model database

summary.raw:
Dragging and drop of model from the online model database was broken. The URI parsing was broken. 

Included is a style fix in ODEJoint_Test.cc, and error checking in VehiclePlugin.cc

Fix for issue #5 in `gazebo_models` repo
